arm_group.description: Single dose of oxcarbazepine suspension, 600 mg, then single dose of trileptal suspension, 600 mg (after washout period)
Single dose of oxcarbazepine suspension, 600 mg, then single dose of trileptal suspension, 600 mg (after washout period

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study was to prove the bioequivalence of  Roxane Laboratories'
      Oxcarbazepine Suspension 600 mg under fasted conditions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Crossover Bioequivalence Study of Oxcarbazepine 600 mg Suspension Under Fasted Conditions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  No clinically significant abnormal findings on the physical examination, medical
             history, or clinical laboratory results during screening

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Positive test for HIV, Hepatitis B, or Hepatitis C.

          -  Treatment with known enzyme altering drugs.

          -  History of allergic or adverse response to oxcarbazepine or any comparable or similar
             product.

facility.name: Worldwide Clinical Trials Drug Development Solutions (formerly CEDRA Clinical Research)

clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose, Two-Period, Two-Treatment, Two-Sequence Crossover Bioequivalence Study of Oxcarbazepine 600 mg Suspension Under Fasted Conditions

overall_official.affiliation: Worldwide Clinical Trials Drug Development Solutions (formerly CEDRA Clinical Research)

primary_outcome.measure: bioequivalence determined by statistical comparison Cmax

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
